question: In a randomized controlled trial, patients are randomly assigned to either treatment or control groups with equal probability. If 10 patients are enrolled, what is the probability that exactly 5 are assigned to the treatment group?
explanation: This follows a binomial distribution with n=10 and p=0.5. P(X=5) = C(10,5) × (0.5)^5 × (0.5)^5 = 252 × (0.5)^10 = 252/1024 = 0.2461 or about 24.6%.
